summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 discussing discovery issues related to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in the Epstein case. The emails involve prosecutors and staff coordinating the handling of email files (mbox files) for BOP employees and inmates, including Epstein, and debating what materials should be produced under a protective order, specifically mentioning post-suicide reconstruction reports.

persons.name: Dave
persons.context: Mentioned as the source from whom more discs containing inmate data (organized by inmate including Epstein) were received in October.

events.title: Receipt of email files
events.description: Email files for certain people were received.

events.title: Receipt of inmate discs
events.description: More discs from Dave, organized by inmate (Epstein, Ryes, Outlaw), were received but could not be opened.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The email chain discusses discovery materials related to the MCC, including mbox files for BOP employees and inmates like Epstein.
There is a debate about whether to produce mbox files for BOP employees beyond just the defendants, as they may be tangentially involved in the events.
Specific mention is made of 'post-suicide reconstruction reports' within BOP document dumps that need consideration for production.
